result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larry Lamar Boone

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Larry Lamar Boone appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Larry Lamar Boone.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Order to Show Cause Hearing.  Defense counsel was recently appointed on this case.  Matter still needs to be scheduled for preliminary hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Larry Lamar Boone not in court, in custody.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status of Counsel held.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel on this case.  Court will schedule for State v. Lee Hearing.  Defendant to appear by zoom at next court date.  Court continues to find GOOD CAUSE to continue to toll time limits of preliminary hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Order to show cause hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Larry Lamar Boone appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with WMS (DOB 12/31/1987)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Larry Lamar Boone appeared by video, in custody at MSDF. Attorney William Hotchkiss appeared by video for Larry Lamar Boone. Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41. 
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised if DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant Court orders the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 & 3. 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
